required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety, PK and Effectiveness of IV Peramivir Versus Oseltamivir in Pediatric Subjects With Uncomplicated Influenza
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Randomized, Open Label, Active-controlled Study to Evaluate the Safety, Pharmacokinetics and Effectiveness of IV Peramivir Compared to Oral Oseltamivir in Pediatric Subjects With Acute Uncomplicated Influenza

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the safety, pharmacokinetics and effectiveness of a single dose of IV peramivir compared to a standard 5 day course of oral oseltamivir in the treatment of pediatric subjects with acute uncomplicated influenza.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety and Tolerability, as Measured by the Number of Participants Experiencing Adverse Events.
primary_outcome.description: Safety evaluation included assessment of Adverse Events (AEs).

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Exposure of IV Peramivir as Measured by the Drug Concentration Over 6 Hours Post-dose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 6 hours post peramivir infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Up to 4 blood samples will be drawn, where possible: immediately following infusion and 30 to 60 mins, 1 to 3 hrs and 4 to 6 hrs post-infusions. AUC calculations were performed in Phoenix WinNonlin using the linear/log trapezoidal rule. AUC0-last was calculated between start of the infusion and the time of the last measurable concentration.

Time for fever resolution based on subject diary record of temperature recorded twice daily. A subject had resolution of fever if he/she had oral temperature of < 99.4°F or an axillary temperature of < 98.4°F and no antipyretic medications were taken for ≥ 12 hours. The time to resolution of fever was estimated for each age group and overall using the Kaplan-Meier method with temperature and symptom relief medication information obtained from the Subject Diary data.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Resolution of Influenza Symptoms
secondary_outcome.description: Subjects or parents or caregivers were asked to provide an assessment of age-appropriate influenza symptoms on a 4-point severity scale (0,absent; 1, mild; 2, moderate; 3, severe) twice daily beginning before screening on Day 1 until symptoms resolved or until the last follow-up visit. Time to alleviation of symptoms was the number of hours from initiation of study drug until the start of the time period in which all age-appropriate symptoms of influenza were either absent or present at a level no greater than mild for at least 21.5 (24 - 10%) hours. Subjects who did not experience alleviation of symptoms were censored at the last observed symptom assessment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Reduction in Viral Shedding
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of viral shedding in bilateral, mid-nasal swab specimens taken at baseline and then on Day 3, 7 and 14.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Influenza Virus Titer in Nasopharyngeal Samples in Response to Treatment.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline assessed on days 3, 7 and 14.
secondary_outcome.description: Change in influenza viral titers was defined as the time-weighted change from Baseline in log_10 tissue culture infective dose_50 (TCID50/mL) and was summarized for each treatment group.

The investigator performed a full physical exam at baseline. At each follow-up visit, study personnel evaluated the subject for the presence of clinical signs and symptoms of the following influenza-related complications: sinusitis, otitis media, bronchitis, and pneumonia requiring antibiotic use, diagnosed after initiation of treatment.

arm_group.description: Subjects randomized to peramivir will receive an age appropriate single dose, diluted to a maximum volume of 100 mL in normal saline, administered as a short intravenous infusion over a minimum of 15 minutes. Subjects ≥12 years will receive a dose of 600 mg. Subjects <12 years will receive a dose of 12 mg/kg (to a maximum dose of 600 mg). Subjects < 6 months will receive a dose of 8 mg/kg.

Subjects randomized to oral oseltamivir will receive an age appropriate dose twice daily for 5 days. Subjects ≥ 13 years will receive a 75mg dose administered as a capsule or oral suspension (twice daily for 5 days). Subjects < 13 years of age will receive a weight-based dose administered as a capsule or oral suspension (twice daily for 5 days).

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
1. Clinical signs and symptoms consistent with acute influenza infection consisting of an oral temperature ≥ 100°F (37.8°C) or rectal temperature ≥ 101.3ºF (≥ 38.5ºC) with at least one respiratory symptom (cough or rhinitis) OR Positive influenza determined by PCR or Rapid Antigen Test
2. Onset of symptoms no more than 72 hours before presentation for screening for subjects < 2 years old.
Key Exclusion Criteria:
1. Pregnant or breast-feeding females
2. Development of symptoms while hospitalized
3. Presence of a chronic disease or illness that may indicate increased risk for influenza-related complications
4. Presence of immunocompromised status

overall_official.affiliation: Chief, Pediatric Infectious Diseases, Louisiana State University

group.title: Peramivir
group.description: Age-appropriate dose Peramivir, administered as a single short iv infusion: Subjects ≥12 years - 600 mg. Subjects <12 years - 12 mg/kg (max. 600 mg). Subjects < 6 months - 8 mg/kg.

group.title: Oseltamivir
group.description: Age appropriate oral dose of Oseltamivir BID for 5 days: Subjects ≥ 13 years - 75mg dose as a capsule or oral suspension. Subjects < 13 years - weight-based dose as a capsule or oral suspension.

participants_list.participants: Milestone only applied to Peramivir group

baseline.population: The Intent-to-Treat (ITTI) population included all randomized subjects and was the primary population for analyses of demography and subject accountability.

group.title: Peramivir
group.description: Age-appropriate single dose Peramivir, administered as a single short iv infusion: Subjects ≥12 years - 600 mg. Subjects <12 years - 12 mg/kg (max. 600 mg). Subjects < 6 months - 8 mg/kg.

group.title: Oseltamivir
group.description: Age appropriate oral dose of Oseltamivir BID for 5 days: Subjects ≥ 13 years - 75mg dose as a capsule or oral suspension. Subjects < 13 years - weight-based dose as a capsule or oral suspension.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
measure.population: Mean age (SD) is reported for the overall ITT population and for each of the 4 age groups
measure.units: Age at time of randomisation - years

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Safety and Tolerability, as Measured by the Number of Participants Experiencing Adverse Events.
outcome.description: Safety evaluation included assessment of Adverse Events (AEs).
outcome.population: The Safety population included all randomized subjects who received ≥ 1 partial dose of peramivir or oseltamivir.

group.title: Peramivir
group.description: Age-appropriate single dose Peramivir, administered as a single short iv infusion: Subjects ≥12 years - 600 mg. Subjects <12 years - 12 mg/kg (max. 600 mg). Subjects < 6 months - 8 mg/kg.

group.title: Oseltamivir
group.description: Age appropriate oral dose of Oseltamivir BID for 5 days: Subjects ≥ 13 years - 75mg dose as a capsule or oral suspension. Subjects < 13 years - weight-based dose as a capsule or oral suspension.

measure.title: Safety and Tolerability, as Measured by the Number of Participants Experiencing Adverse Events.
measure.description: Safety evaluation included assessment of Adverse Events (AEs).
measure.population: The Safety population included all randomized subjects who received ≥ 1 partial dose of peramivir or oseltamivir.

class.title: Adverse Event possibly, probably, or definitely related to study drug
Adverse Event leading to discontinuation from study

outcome.title: Plasma Exposure of IV Peramivir as Measured by the Drug Concentration Over 6 Hours Post-dose
outcome.description: Up to 4 blood samples will be drawn, where possible: immediately following infusion and 30 to 60 mins, 1 to 3 hrs and 4 to 6 hrs post-infusions. AUC calculations were performed in Phoenix WinNonlin using the linear/log trapezoidal rule. AUC0-last was calculated between start of the infusion and the time of the last measurable concentration.
outcome.time_frame: up to 6 hours post peramivir infusion
outcome.population: The Intent-to-Treat (ITTI) population included all randomized subjects. Of these 114 subjects, 106 had sufficient PK samples collected for inclusion in the peramivir PK analysis

group.title: Peramivir (≥ 28 Days - < 2 Years)
group.description: Age-appropriate dose Peramivir, administered as a single short iv infusion: Subjects <2 years - 12 mg/kg (max. 600 mg). Subjects < 6 months - 8 mg/kg.

group.title: Peramivir (≥ 2 - < 7 Years)
group.description: 12 mg/kg (max. 600 mg) dose Peramivir, administered as a single short iv infusion

group.title: Peramivir (≥ 7 - < 13 Years)
group.description: Age-appropriate dose Peramivir, administered as a single short iv infusion: Subjects ≥12 years - 600 mg. Subjects <12 years - 12 mg/kg (max. 600 mg).

group.title: Peramivir (≥ 13 - < 18 Years)
group.description: 600 mg dose Peramivir, administered as a single short iv infusion

measure.title: Plasma Exposure of IV Peramivir as Measured by the Drug Concentration Over 6 Hours Post-dose
measure.description: Up to 4 blood samples will be drawn, where possible: immediately following infusion and 30 to 60 mins, 1 to 3 hrs and 4 to 6 hrs post-infusions. AUC calculations were performed in Phoenix WinNonlin using the linear/log trapezoidal rule. AUC0-last was calculated between start of the infusion and the time of the last measurable concentration.
measure.population: The Intent-to-Treat (ITTI) population included all randomized subjects. Of these 114 subjects, 106 had sufficient PK samples collected for inclusion in the peramivir PK analysis

outcome.title: Time to Resolution of Fever
outcome.description: Time for fever resolution based on subject diary record of temperature recorded twice daily. A subject had resolution of fever if he/she had oral temperature of < 99.4°F or an axillary temperature of < 98.4°F and no antipyretic medications were taken for ≥ 12 hours. The time to resolution of fever was estimated for each age group and overall using the Kaplan-Meier method with temperature and symptom relief medication information obtained from the Subject Diary data.
outcome.population: Intent to treat infected (ITTI) population. Subjects who did not have resolution of fever were censored at the time of their last non-missing post-baseline temperature assessment; this included 1 subject in the '≥ 28 days - < 2 years' cohort treated with Peramivir. Seventeen subjects were excluded from summaries due to missing data or events resolving prior to initiation of study drug.

measure.title: Time to Resolution of Fever
measure.description: Time for fever resolution based on subject diary record of temperature recorded twice daily. A subject had resolution of fever if he/she had oral temperature of < 99.4°F or an axillary temperature of < 98.4°F and no antipyretic medications were taken for ≥ 12 hours. The time to resolution of fever was estimated for each age group and overall using the Kaplan-Meier method with temperature and symptom relief medication information obtained from the Subject Diary data.
measure.population: Intent to treat infected (ITTI) population. Subjects who did not have resolution of fever were censored at the time of their last non-missing post-baseline temperature assessment; this included 1 subject in the '≥ 28 days - < 2 years' cohort treated with Peramivir. Seventeen subjects were excluded from summaries due to missing data or events resolving prior to initiation of study drug.

outcome.title: Time to Resolution of Influenza Symptoms
outcome.description: Subjects or parents or caregivers were asked to provide an assessment of age-appropriate influenza symptoms on a 4-point severity scale (0,absent; 1, mild; 2, moderate; 3, severe) twice daily beginning before screening on Day 1 until symptoms resolved or until the last follow-up visit. Time to alleviation of symptoms was the number of hours from initiation of study drug until the start of the time period in which all age-appropriate symptoms of influenza were either absent or present at a level no greater than mild for at least 21.5 (24 - 10%) hours. Subjects who did not experience alleviation of symptoms were censored at the last observed symptom assessment.
outcome.population: Intent to treat infected (ITTI) population. Subjects with no alleviation of symptoms were censored at date of last post-baseline assessment; including 1 subject in the '≥ 28 days to < 2 yrs, Peramivir' group, 1 subject in the '≥ 2 to < 7 yrs, Peramivir' group, 4 subjects in the '≥ 7 to < 13 yrs, Peramivir' group and 1 subject each in the '≥ 13 to < 18 yrs' Peramivir and Oseltamivir groups. Seven subjects were excluded due to missing data or events resolving prior to initiation of study drug.

measure.title: Time to Resolution of Influenza Symptoms
measure.description: Subjects or parents or caregivers were asked to provide an assessment of age-appropriate influenza symptoms on a 4-point severity scale (0,absent; 1, mild; 2, moderate; 3, severe) twice daily beginning before screening on Day 1 until symptoms resolved or until the last follow-up visit. Time to alleviation of symptoms was the number of hours from initiation of study drug until the start of the time period in which all age-appropriate symptoms of influenza were either absent or present at a level no greater than mild for at least 21.5 (24 - 10%) hours. Subjects who did not experience alleviation of symptoms were censored at the last observed symptom assessment.
measure.population: Intent to treat infected (ITTI) population. Subjects with no alleviation of symptoms were censored at date of last post-baseline assessment; including 1 subject in the '≥ 28 days to < 2 yrs, Peramivir' group, 1 subject in the '≥ 2 to < 7 yrs, Peramivir' group, 4 subjects in the '≥ 7 to < 13 yrs, Peramivir' group and 1 subject each in the '≥ 13 to < 18 yrs' Peramivir and Oseltamivir groups. Seven subjects were excluded due to missing data or events resolving prior to initiation of study drug.

outcome.title: Time to Reduction in Viral Shedding
outcome.description: Assessment of viral shedding in bilateral, mid-nasal swab specimens taken at baseline and then on Day 3, 7 and 14.
outcome.population: Intent to treat infected (ITTI) population + ITT population with positive baseline influenza viral titers [> 0.5 log10 TCID50/mL]; a total of 84 subjects.

measure.title: Time to Reduction in Viral Shedding
measure.description: Assessment of viral shedding in bilateral, mid-nasal swab specimens taken at baseline and then on Day 3, 7 and 14.
measure.population: Intent to treat infected (ITTI) population + ITT population with positive baseline influenza viral titers [> 0.5 log10 TCID50/mL]; a total of 84 subjects.

outcome.title: Changes in Influenza Virus Titer in Nasopharyngeal Samples in Response to Treatment.
outcome.description: Change in influenza viral titers was defined as the time-weighted change from Baseline in log_10 tissue culture infective dose_50 (TCID50/mL) and was summarized for each treatment group.
outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline assessed on days 3, 7 and 14.
outcome.population: The Intent To Treat Infected (ITTI) population included all subjects who were enrolled, received study drug, and had confirmed influenza A and/or B by PCR. Thirteen subjects were excluded due to a negative or missing baseline titer.

group.title: Peramivir
group.description: Age-appropriate single dose Peramivir, administered as a single short iv infusion: Subjects ≥12 years - 600 mg. Subjects <12 years - 12 mg/kg (max. 600 mg). Subjects < 6 months - 8 mg/kg.

group.title: Oseltamivir
group.description: Age appropriate oral dose of Oseltamivir BID for 5 days: Subjects ≥ 13 years - 75mg dose as a capsule or oral suspension. Subjects < 13 years - weight-based dose as a capsule or oral suspension.

measure.title: Changes in Influenza Virus Titer in Nasopharyngeal Samples in Response to Treatment.
measure.description: Change in influenza viral titers was defined as the time-weighted change from Baseline in log_10 tissue culture infective dose_50 (TCID50/mL) and was summarized for each treatment group.
measure.population: The Intent To Treat Infected (ITTI) population included all subjects who were enrolled, received study drug, and had confirmed influenza A and/or B by PCR. Thirteen subjects were excluded due to a negative or missing baseline titer.

outcome.title: Influenza-Related Complications Assessment.
outcome.description: The investigator performed a full physical exam at baseline. At each follow-up visit, study personnel evaluated the subject for the presence of clinical signs and symptoms of the following influenza-related complications: sinusitis, otitis media, bronchitis, and pneumonia requiring antibiotic use, diagnosed after initiation of treatment.

group.title: Peramivir
group.description: Age-appropriate single dose Peramivir, administered as a single short iv infusion: Subjects ≥12 years - 600 mg. Subjects <12 years - 12 mg/kg (max. 600 mg). Subjects < 6 months - 8 mg/kg.

group.title: Oseltamivir
group.description: Age appropriate oral dose of Oseltamivir BID for 5 days: Subjects ≥ 13 years - 75mg dose as a capsule or oral suspension. Subjects < 13 years - weight-based dose as a capsule or oral suspension.

measure.title: Influenza-Related Complications Assessment.
measure.description: The investigator performed a full physical exam at baseline. At each follow-up visit, study personnel evaluated the subject for the presence of clinical signs and symptoms of the following influenza-related complications: sinusitis, otitis media, bronchitis, and pneumonia requiring antibiotic use, diagnosed after initiation of treatment.

reported_events.time_frame: AEs were recorded on Day 1, Day 3, Day 7 and Day 14/Early Withdraw visit.
reported_events.desc: Adverse events were graded through use of the Division of Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndrome (DAIDS) Tables for Grading Adult and Pediatric Adverse Experiences. Influenza-related complications were not considered AEs unless they met the criteria for an SAE.

group.title: Peramivir
group.description: Age-appropriate single dose Peramivir, administered as a single short iv infusion: Subjects ≥12 years - 600 mg. Subjects <12 years - 12 mg/kg (max. 600 mg). Subjects < 6 months - 8 mg/kg.

group.title: Oseltamivir
group.description: Age appropriate oral dose of Oseltamivir BID for 5 days: Subjects ≥ 13 years - 75mg dose as a capsule or oral suspension. Subjects < 13 years - weight-based dose as a capsule or oral suspension.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
